founders.name: Josh Buckley, Founder/CEO
founders.description: Founder of Mino Games (YC W11). Early investor in Rippling, Flock Safety, Applied Intuition, Figma, Gecko Robotics, Vercel, Athelas, Boom, Solugen, Relativity Space, Mercury, Astranis, ClassDojo, Retool, Lattice and many more.

generated_description:
Mino Games is a mobile games company based in Montreal, Canada. Founded as part of Y Combinator's Batch W11, it quickly made a name for itself as a Top-25 grossing mobile gaming studio. Backed by notable investors like Andreessen Horowitz and Y Combinator, the company has positioned itself to thrive in the competitive gaming industry.

With a team of just 11 employees, Mino Games is small but ambitious, focusing on creating engaging gaming experiences for mobile users. Their mission revolves around delivering entertaining and dynamic games, aiming to capture a global audience.

While specifics about their current projects are limited, they seem to be leveraging platforms like WordPress to expand their online presence and community engagement. You can check out their work at their website, [minomonsters.com](http://minomonsters.com).

In essence, Mino Games exemplifies a modern startup: lean, smartly funded, and dedicated to carving out its niche in the gaming world. They have the backing, the vision, and the talent to potentially make waves in the industry—keep an eye on them.
